holidays.name: National Comic Book Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the colorful world of comic books, from superheroes to graphic novels and everything in between.
holidays.origin: Established to honor the impact of comic books on pop culture and storytelling, encouraging readers all over the world to dive into comics.
holidays.funFact: The first comic book is considered to be 'The Yellow Kid' from the 1890s, but National Comic Book Day specifically boosts sales and love for comics every September 25!

holidays.name: National Lobster Day
holidays.description: A celebration dedicated to enjoying the sumptuous taste of lobster, one of the ocean's most delicious crustaceans.
holidays.origin: Originated to promote lobster consumption and honor lobster fisherman communities, especially in New England, USA.
holidays.funFact: Despite its luxury status today, lobsters were once so plentiful they were used as fertilizer and considered poor people’s food!

holidays.name: Daughters and Sons Day
holidays.description: A heartfelt day for parents to honor their children and for children to show appreciation to their parents, recognizing the family bond and generational connections.
holidays.origin: Created by the American Family Therapy Academy to emphasize family unity and mutual respect.
holidays.funFact: This day encourages family meetings and activities to strengthen communication—perfect excuse for some quality fun time!

holidays.name: National One-Hit Wonder Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration of those artists and bands who scored one memorable hit song before disappearing from the radar.
holidays.origin: Created by music enthusiasts and radio stations to recognize the catchy hits that stuck in our heads despite the artists’ fleeting fame.
holidays.funFact: Some one-hit wonders have made more money from their single hit than some artists with long careers!
